docs.snippet: Last week was something special for Otto C. Schwarz of Union and Philip J. Gans of Scotch Plains. They went to Washington to be the official hosts for the Bicentennial visit of 15 Australians who helped to build the infamous railroad bridge over the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Last week was something special for Otto C. Schwarz of Union and Philip J. Gans of Scotch Plains. They went to Washington to be the official hosts for the Bicentennial visit of 15 Australians who helped to build the infamous railroad bridge over the River Kwai in Thailand during World War II. Mr. Schwarz and Mr. Gans also were prisoners of the Japanese they were captured after the sinking of the heavy...
docs.abstract: 27-yr-old Princeton Prof Charles Fefferman is chosen from among 232 nominees to receive Natl Science Foundation's 1st Alan T Waterman Award and $50,000 grant to spend next 3 yrs doing research; Fefferman entered coll at age 14, received doctorate at 20 and joined Chicago Univ as youngest prof in nation (S)

headline.main: PEOPLE; New Ending For Old Film

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 12 (AP) The armed forces ousted President Juan Maria Bordaberry today because of "irreconcilable differences" and replaced him with his 80-year-old vice president, Alberto Demicheli.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 12 (AP) The armed forces ousted President Juan Maria Bordaberry today because of "irreconcilable differences" and replaced him with his 80-year-old vice president, Alberto Demicheli.
docs.abstract: Armed forces in Uruguay oust Pres Juan Maria Bordaberry because of 'irreconcilable differences' and replace him with 80-yr-old vice pres Alberto Demichell; mil sources say Demichell will remain Pres for 60 days while special electoral council selects new Pres; dispute centers around future of democratic insts in Uruguay; Bordaberry had reptdly wanted to abolish pol parties and set up corporate state structure with participation of armed forces written into law; armed forces reptdly preferred status quo, with gradual return to traditional pol (M)

headline.main: Military in Uruguay Ousts President Over Policy Differences

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 13 An atmosphere of absolute calm prevailed here today after the overthrow of President Juan Maria Bordaberry by the armed forces, which had governed with him for three years.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 13 An atmosphere of absolute calm prevailed here today after the overthrow of President Juan Maria Bordaberry by the armed forces, which had governed with him for three years.
docs.abstract: atmosphere of calm prevails in Uruguay after overthrow of Pres Juan Maria Bordaberry by armed forces; Alfredo Demichell took over as interim Pres; Bordaberry was overthrown after he was unable to agree with mil on future framework of Govt; mil leaders have held real pol power for last 3 yrs but allowed Bordaberry to continue in office because he largely agreed with efforts to wipe out leftist subversion at any cost, remove traditional populist politicians from power and bring unruly labor movement to heel; leaders became miffed at Bordaberry's attempt to continue in power and lay out his own guidelines for future Govt; the removal of Bordaberry scarcely disrupted the public (L)

headline.main: Uruguayans Take the Fall of President With the Utmost Calm

byline.original: By JONATHAN KANDELL Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: Dr. Charles C. Griffin, a scholar and expert in Latin American history and former dean of the faculty at Vassar College in Poughkeepsie, N.Y., died yesterday at his Hyde Park, N.Y., home at the age of 74. He had been ill with emphysema.
docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Charles C. Griffin, a scholar and expert in Latin American history and former dean of the faculty at Vassar College in Poughkeepsie, N.Y., died yesterday at his Hyde Park, N.Y., home at the age of 74. He had been ill with emphysema.

headline.main: Charles C. Griffin Dead at 74; Latin American History Expert

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 14 The overthrow of the eleced president, Juan Maria Bordaberry, has eliminated the last pretense of democratic government in Uruguay.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 14 The overthrow of the eleced president, Juan Maria Bordaberry, has eliminated the last pretense of democratic government in Uruguay.
docs.abstract: article on overthrow of Uruguay Pres Juan Maria Bordaberry; mil, which ousted Bordaberry, says ouster will pave way for eventual return to democratic processes; Uruguayan mil leaders appear to be looking to Brazil for guidelines, but 12 yrs after Brazilian armed forces took power, Govt is still mil dictatorship; according to mil spokesmen, Alberto Demichell, who is interim Pres, will step down in next 70 days and he will be replaced by civilian candidate; new chief exec will reptdly remain in office about 3 yrs, after which the 2 traditional pol parties will be reactivated and will select consensus Pres to govern for 5 yrs; Uruguay's two-party system described; history of military involvement in Govt; Demichell illus (L)

headline.main: Uruguay Awaits Form of Democracy Army Says It Will Eventually Restore

byline.original: By JONATHAN KANDELL Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 15 (AP) A National Council of 25 civilians and 22 military officers, formed after a weekend coup, will select a new president in August for a three-year term, the Government said today.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 15 (AP) A National Council of 25 civilians and 22 military officers, formed after a weekend coup, will select a new president in August for a three-year term, the Government said today.
docs.abstract: Uruguayan Govt announces Natl Council will select new pres in Aug for 3-yr term; mil sources say recent coup will not alter policies of Econ Min Alejandro Vegh Villegas, who is credited with cooling nation's once disruptive inflation (S)

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 16 (Reuters) Seven senior United States diplomats have been kidnapped in the last eight years and four United States ambassadors or chiefs of missions have been killed, according to State Department figures.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 16 (Reuters) Seven senior United States diplomats have been kidnapped in the last eight years and four United States ambassadors or chiefs of missions have been killed, according to State Department figures.
docs.abstract: State Dept data show 7 sr US diplomats have been kidnapped in last 8 yrs and 4 US ambs or chiefs of missions have been killed; Palestinians have kidnapped number of US diplomats in Jordan and Lebanon since '70; partial chronology of such attacks since '68 (M)

headline.main: 4 U.S. DIPLOMATS SLAIN IN 8 YEARS; 7 Senior Officials Abducted Since 1968, Data Show

docs.snippet: SANTIAGO, Chile, June 16 A large majority of American governments called on Chile today to allow the Inter-American Human Rights Commission to continue monitoring violations and collecting information in this country.
docs.lead_paragraph: SANTIAGO, Chile, June 16 A large majority of American governments called on Chile today to allow the Inter-American Human Rights Commission to continue monitoring violations and collecting information in this country.
docs.abstract: petition requesting ind investigation of charges of torture is presented to Uruguay's delegation to UN by Amnesty Internatl; is said to have signatures of 350,000 people in 70 countries, including Andrei D Sakharov of USSR, Sean McBride of Ireland and other Nobel laureates; Uruguayan Wilson Ferreira Aldunate charges that Argentine police, acting on orders issued by Uruguayan Govt, was responsibile for killing of Zelmar Michelini and Hector Gutierrez Ruiz, former Uruguayan legislators exiled in Argentina; group of Uruguayan journalists attending news conf challenge charge (S)

headline.main: O.A.S. APPEALING TO CHILE ON RIGHTS; 21 of 23 Nations Vote to Urge Santiago to Allow Commission to Work
